main event: Captain Charles H. McMahon reported seeing an unidentified aerial object over Robins Air Force Base, Georgia on April 10, 1950.
interesting points: The object had a red glowing rim around the widest part, with a white shiny rim behind it. The interior portion seemed to be illuminated.
The object compared in size to a medium-sized automobile, with the bottom part appearing to be about 25 inches in diameter and the overall diameter estimated to be around 25 feet.
The object made a sharp dip sideways, following the line of the horizon for about 100 feet, then banked and gained altitude before disappearing.
There were no odors or sounds coming from the object, and it moved with the speed and acceleration of a baseball.
Captain McMahon and Sergeant Harrell both observed the object, and Sergeant Harrell believed it was under deliberate control.
witnesses: Captain Charles H. McMahon and Sergeant Lovett G. Harrell, Jr.
